items.title: Resume
items.summary: Position 2019-now: DR1 CNRS and researcher at CREATIS / Léon Bérard cancer center 2013-2019: DR2 CNRS and researcher at CREATIS / Léon Bérard cancer center (DR means Directeur de Recherche or Senior Permanent…
items.content_html:
Position

  • 2019-now: DR1 CNRS and researcher at CREATIS / Léon Bérard cancer center
  • 2013-2019: DR2 CNRS and researcher at CREATIS / Léon Bérard cancer center
    (DR means Directeur de Recherche or Senior Permanent Researcher)
  • 2008-2013: CR1 CNRS and researcher at CREATIS / Léon Bérard cancer center
    (CR means Chargé de Recherche or Permanent Researcher)
  • 2004-2008: researcher at Léon Bérard cancer center
  • 2000-2004: assistant professor at université Lumière Lyon 2

Education and Degrees

  • 2008: HDR (Habilitation à Diriger les Recherches)
    Université Claude Bernard Lyon 1.
    Imagerie dynamique et simulations Monte-Carlo pour la radiothérapie guidée par l’image
  • 2000: PhD
    Université Lumière Lyon 2.
    Recalage multimodal et plate-forme d’imagerie médicale à accès distant

items.title: Projects
items.summary: "Projects" : how to turn coffee into research articles ... 2020-2024 Mocamed (ANR) Advanced Monte Carlo Methods for Medical Physics 2020-2024 Popeye (EU. ERA…
items.content_html:
• 2020-2024 Mocamed (ANR) Advanced Monte Carlo Methods for Medical Physics
  • 2020-2024 Popeye (EU. ERA Per Med). Personalised Optimisation of Prognostic and thErapeutic protocols with Lu-177 for MNETs, through the development of advanced computational tools and a portable detection sYstEm
  • 2020-2022 Delpel (INSERM, INCa, Aviesan). Deep Learning for dose monitoring in EBRT of pelvic cancers.
  • 2020-2022 Nadiam (Région RA. Pack Ambition). NucleAr meDicine ImAging with Motion
  • 2019-2021 Kitware (indus.). Breathing motion correction in SPECT
  • 2019-2021 Philips (indus.). Quantification de l’Yttrium-90 par l’imagerie PET par simulation Monte Carlo.
  • 2018-2023: LYRICAN Lyon Integrated Research Center. Resp. of PRI3 “Physical agents to analyse and overcome tumor plasticity at the macroscopic level”
  • 2016-2018: SPEDIV. Single Photon Emission and Detection for In-Vivo Nanoparticles Quantification. PhysiCancer project.
  • 2014-2018: t-Gate aka theranostic-GATE. ANR project.
  • 2014-2017: Dexter. ANR project.
  • 2012-2014: MC-SMART (Monte-Carlo SMall Animal Radiation Therapy). Physi-Cancer project.
  • 2012-2019: Labex PRIMES. Physics, Radiobiology, Medical Imaging and Simulations. Resp. of WP5 “Modelling and simulation”.
  • 2012-2017: LYRIC. Lyon Integrated Research Center. Resp. of WP4 “Image guided local treatments”.
  • 2010-2016: Elekta Lung MidP clinical trial. First patient octobre 2012.
  • 2010-2014: ENVISION. FP7 Cooperation
  • 2009-2012: hGate. ANR Cosinus
  • 2009-2013: ULICE. FP7 Capacities Research Infrastructures
  • 2008-2012: PARTNER. FP7 Initial training network, Marie Curie
  • 2008-2009: Philips. Lung ventilation study
  • 2007-2011: Miniara. Pôle de compétitivité Medicen
  • 2006-2010: fGate. ANR “Calcul intensif et simulation”
  • 2006-2010: Simca2. ANR “blanche”

items.title: PhD and post-doc advisory
items.summary: Current PhDs Théo Kaprelian (start 2021-10) - Co-supervisor: Ane Etxebeste. Monte Carlo simulations guided by artificial intelligence for medical physics and nuclear medicine.
items.content_html:
Current PhDs

  • Théo Kaprelian (start 2021-10) - Co-supervisor: Ane Etxebeste.
    Monte Carlo simulations guided by artificial intelligence for medical physics and nuclear medicine. Study of GANs to model phase spaces.
  • Laure  Vergnaud (start 2020-09) - Co-supervisor: Jean-Noel Badel.
    Dosimetry for 177Lu treatments in internal radiotherapy based on imaging and Monte Carlo simulations
  • Antoine Robert (start 2018-10) - Co-supervisor: Simon Rit.
    Breathing motion correction in SPECT quantitation

Past PhD (defended phd thesis)

(16) 2021-09 Joey Labour
Investigating Y- 90 digital PET imaging with Monte-Carlo simulations and machine-learning
Co-supervisor:Jean-Nöel Badel

(15) 2019-10 Yue-Meng Feng
Modeling and regularization in tomographic reconstruction for Compton camera imaging
Co-supervisor: Voichita Maxim, Jean-Michel Létang.

(14) 2019-01 Alessio Elia
Gate as a Geant4-based Monte-Carlo platform to support medical commissioning and Treatment Planning System verification in scanned ion beam therapy.
Co-supervisor: Loic Grevillot.

(13) 2017-05 Brent Fokke Bram Huisman
Accelerated Clinical Prompt Gamma simulations for Proton Therapy.
Co-supervisor: Etienne Testa.

(12) 2015-11 Marie Fargier-Voiron
Optimisation et évaluation des performances d’un système à ultrasons en radiothérapie adaptative.
Co-supervisor: Marie-Claude Biston.

(11) 2013-12 Vivien Delmon
Recalage déformable de projections de scanner X à faisceau conique.
Co-supervisor: S. Rit.

(10) 2013-11 Gauthier Bouilhol
Incertitudes et mouvement dans le traitement des tumeurs pulmonaires: de la radiothérapie à l’hadronthérapie.
Co-supervisor: M. Ayadi.

(9) 2011-12 Louise Grezes-Besset
Suivi de la respiration par imagerie multimodalité dans le cadre de la radiothérapie du poumon.
Co-supervisor: P. Clarysse.

(8) 2011-10 Marie Vidal
Evolution des modèles de calcul pour le logiciel de planification de la dose en Protonthérapie.
Co-supervisor: P. François.

(7) 2011-10 Loic Grevillot
Development of Monte Carlo platform to assess patient dose distribution for proton and carbon ion therapy.
Co-supervisor: N. Freud.

(6) 2010-07 Jef Vandemeulebroucke
Breathing thorax modeling from 4D imaging for dynamic radiotherapeutic dose estimation.
Co-supervisor: P. Clarysse.

(5) 2010-06 Nabil Zahra
Mesure de dose en thérapie par ions carbone: mise en place d’un dispositif expérimental et simulations Monte­-Carlo.
Co-supervisor: P. Lautesse.

(4) 2009-12 Jean-Noel Badel
Contrôle dosimétrique des traitements de radiothérapie par simulation Monte Carlo de l’image de dose portale transmise.
Co-supervisor: I. Magnin.

(3) 2007-11 Myriam Ayadi
Dosimétrie dynamique (4D) pour le traitement du cancer du poumon.
Co-supervisor: M. Boutemeur.

(2) 2007-09 Simon Rit
Acquisition d’images tomodensitométriques dynamiques (4D) à partir d’un tomographe à géométrie conique.
Co-supervisor: S. Miguet.

(1) 2006-02 Vlad Boldea
Intégration de la respiration en radiothérapie: apport du recalage déformable d’images.
Co-supervisor: S. Miguet.

items.title: I like to code it, code it
items.summary: Open-Source software development VV This is an image viewer, specialized to 3D and 4D CT images and image registration evaluation. Very simple and…
items.content_html:
Open-Source software development

VV
This is an image viewer, specialized to 3D and 4D CT images and image registration evaluation. Very simple and fast.

GATE
A Monte-Carlo simulation software simulations for medical physics, in particular preclinical and clinical images in emission tomography, transmission tomography and Radiation Therapy (RT). I am the initiator the extension of Gate to the RT domain. 

Gatelab
The GateLab is an end-user application allowing researchers to easily execute GATE on a computing grid (EGEE). It consists of a web server based on Moteur and of a Java client using VBrowser as GUI for the logic catalog (LFC) of the EGEE grid.

SYD
Work in progress. Do not use it (.... yet) !
SYD is a command line environnement and a C++ toolkit to perform image processing tasks on a database of medical images. It is initially developed to manage SPECT/CT images and perform tasks such as computing activity or integrated activity in various ROIs, in the field of Target Radionuclide Therapy and nuclear medicine.

… and Open Data

POPI
We believe research on deformable image registration (DIR) of the lungs will greatly benefit from making image and validation data publicly available. Several 4D CT data sets, acquired at the Léon Bérard Cancer Center, can be downloaded here for use in your research. Along with the images, we provide large sets of manually identified landmarks, allowing you to validate your motion estimation.

Lymph stations
We provide the dataset that have been used in the publication [Sarrut 2014, Lynch 2013, Pitson 2012]. This dataset consists on thoracic CT images of five lung cancer patients on which three experts (RL, LC, GP) consensually delineated lymph nodes stations 1 to 11, following the new IASLC stations definition [Rusch et al 2009]. Several anatomical structures (such as Aorta, vessels etc) are also available.
